title: Inheritance
subtitle: Building on Existing Classes
description:
# Inheritance

Inheritance allows you to create new classes based on existing ones. The new class (child) inherits all properties and methods from the parent class, plus can add its own!

## Basic Inheritance

```python
class Character:
    def __init__(self, name, health):
        self.name = name
        self.health = health
    
    def take_damage(self, amount):
        self.health -= amount

class Warrior(Character):  # Warrior inherits from Character
    def __init__(self, name, health, armor):
        super().__init__(name, health)  # Call parent constructor
        self.armor = armor  # New property
    
    def shield_block(self):  # New method
        print(f"{self.name} blocks with shield!")

warrior = Warrior("Conan", 150, 50)
warrior.take_damage(20)  # Inherited method
warrior.shield_block()  # New method
```

## Why Use Inheritance?

- Reuse code from existing classes
- Create specialized versions of classes
- Organize code hierarchically

## Your Quest

Create a Mage class that inherits from Character:

1. Define Character class with __init__(name, health) and attack() method
2. attack() should print "[name] attacks!"
3. Create Mage class that inherits from Character
4. Mage __init__ takes name, health, and mana
5. Add cast_spell() method that prints "[name] casts a spell!"
6. Create Mage("Gandalf", 80, 100)
7. Call both attack() and cast_spell()

Expected output:
```
Gandalf attacks!
Gandalf casts a spell!
```
